suppress.notes: file name: GetDocument.Insider.dll Suppressing this CVE as it is a .NetCore runtime issue affecting .NetCore runtimes below .NET Core 3.1.4 or lower. The ESS Runs in an AppService which will have the fixes already applied, and the global.json has been addeded to require .NetCore 3.1.408 or greater. More details can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/156

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll An information disclosure vulnerability exists in .NET Framework and .NET Core which allows bypassing Cross-origin Resource Sharing (CORS) configurations, aka ".NET Framework Information Disclosure Vulnerability." This applies to version of System.Net.Http as deployed as part of .Net core below 2.1.7 or 2.2.1. ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/97 for MS details on this CVE. This CVE only applies to .NetCore versions below 2.1.8 and 2.2.2. ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/111 for MS details on this CVE. Package name: System.Text.RegularExpressions.dll (included as part of the .Net Core runtime) Vulnerable versions: 4.3.0 and below Secure versions: 4.3.1+ This CVE applies to .Net Core versions below 2.2.107 (runtime 2.2.5). ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/112 for full MS Details on the CVE A denial of service vulnerability exists when .NET Framework or .NET Core improperly handle web requests, aka '.Net Framework and .Net Core Denial of Service Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2019-0820, CVE-2019-0981. Vunerability applies to System.Private.Uri version 4.3.0 and 4.3.1. System.Private.Uri is part of the .NetCore runtime, and fixed with version System.Private.Uri version 4.3.2. ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/113 for full MS Details on the CVE Vunerability applies to System.Private.Uri version 4.3.0 and 4.3.1. System.Private.Uri is part of the .NetCore runtime, and fixed with version System.Private.Uri version 4.3.2. The issue is fixed: 2.1.11 or SDK 2.1.507 for Visual Studio 2017 or SDK 2.1.604 for Visual Studio 2019 2.2.5 or SDK 2.2.107 for Visual Studio 2017 or SDK 2.2.204 for Visual Studio 2019 ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/121 for full MS Details on CVE. A denial of service vulnerability exists when .NET Core improperly handles web requests. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause a denial of service against a .NET Core web application. The vulnerability can be exploited remotely, without authentication. This CVE applies to any .NET Core based application running on .NET Core 2.1.0-2.1.12, or .NET Core 2.2.0-2.2.6. ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/175 for full MS Details on CVE. .NET Core and Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability. This CVE applies to any .NET Core 3.1 but patch is provided at 3.1.405, ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/176 for full MS Details on CVE. A remote code execution vulnerability exists when parsing certain types of graphics files. This vulnerability only exists on systems running on MacOS or Linux. This CVE applies to any .NET Core 3.1 but patch is provided at 3.1.405, ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/194 for full MS Details on CVE. A denial of service vulnerability exists in .NET 5.0, .NET Core 3.1 and .NET Core 2.1 where .NET (Core) server applications providing WebSocket endpoints could be tricked into endlessly looping while trying to read a single WebSocket frame. This CVE applies to any .NET Core 3.1 but patch is provided at 3.1.412, ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/178 for full MS Details on CVE. A remote code execution vulnerability exists in .NET 5 and .NET Core due to how text encoding is performed.This vulnerability is for System.Text.Encodings.Web and fixed on 5.0.1 and we are using 5.0.1 This CVE applies to any .NET Core 3.1 but patch is provided at 3.1.407, ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/196 for full MS Details on CVE. An information disclosure vulnerability exists in .NET 5.0, .NET Core 3.1 and .NET Core 2.1 when dumps created by the tool to collect crash dumps and dumps on demand are created with global read permissions on Linux and macOS. This CVE applies to any .NET Core 3.1 but patch is provided at 3.1.412, ESS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: Serilog.Sinks.Async.dll A vulnerability exists in Async through 3.2.1 (fixed in 3.2.2) , which could let a malicious user obtain privileges via the mapValues() method. This is a false positive as the vulnerability exists in a NPM Javascript package named 'Async' and not the nuget .NET package named 'Serilog.Sinks.Async'.

file name: Azure.Storage.Blobs:12.13.0 See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/111 for MS details on this CVE. Package name: Azure.Storage.Blobs (included as part of the .Net Core runtime) Vulnerable versions: 12.10.0 and below This CVE applies to .NET Core 2.1, .NET Core 1.0, .NET Core 1.1, PowerShell Core 6.0. MSI is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 for .NET and Visual Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability. This is a temporary suppression pending a fix being available. We have since upgraded this package. This is a false positive.

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-8409 for details on this CVE. Note: This was reanalysed by NIST on 4th October, and is now a breaking issue. Affects .NET Core 2.1 - now on .NET 6 so false positive. See https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-us/vulnerability/CVE-2018-8409

file name: Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-1147 for details on this CVE. This is a temporary suppression pending a fix being available. Bug to track the fix - https://dev.azure.com/ukhydro/Abzu/_boards/board/t/Abzu%20Delivery%20Team/Stories/?workitem=58192

file name: System.Net.WebSockets.Client:4.0.0 For details on these CVEs see: http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2017-0247 http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2017-0249 http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2017-0256 This is a temporary suppression pending a fix being available. Bug to track the fix - https://dev.azure.com/ukhydro/Abzu/_boards/board/t/Abzu%20Delivery%20Team/Stories/?workitem=58195
vulnerability: DOS Affects >Net >= 6.0.0, < 6.0.12. Currently running Net 6.0.13, sdk 6.0.405
vulnerability: Buffer overflow and spoofing Affects .Net 3.1 .Net 5.0 and <= .Net 6.0.8 Currently running Net 6.0.13, sdk 6.0.405
vulnerability: .NET Framework Information Disclosure Affects .Net 4.x.x Currently running Net 6.0.13, sdk 6.0.405
vulnerability: .NET and Visual Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability Affects .Net 6.0.0 Currently running Net 6.0.13, sdk 6.0.405
vulnerability: Information disclosure Affects Active directory up to 2021-11-02
vulnerability: Elevation of Privilege Affects Azure Open Management Infrastructure (OMI) version <= 1.6.9-0 (VMs running Linux)

file name: System.Runtime.Serialization.Json:4.0.2, System.Runtime.Serialization.Json:4.3.0, System.Text.Json:4.6.0, System.Text.Json:4.7.2, System.Text.Json:7.0.0 These packages are dependencies of nuget packages. All packages at latest version, must update dependent packages when newer versions are available.
file name: System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates:4.1.0 This part of .NetCoreApp. Either waiting on fix through .net sdk to fix, or update to .net core 8 when available.
file name: Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms:3.1.0 False positive - only affects .Net Framework.
